title: FOOTBALL: Madison hired as College Park head coach
text:
FOOTBALL: Madison hired as College Park head coach 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Klein Collins defensive coordinator and former Texas A&M football player Lonnie Madison has officially been hired as the next head football coach and athletic director at College Park High School , a decision approved by the Conroe ISD Board of Trustees on Tuesday evening. 
Madison is set to take over the program from Richard Carson , who announced his retirement earlier this year. Carson has been the Cavaliers' head coach since the school opened in 2005. 
Along with his defensive coordinator role at Klein Collins, Madison also served as defensive backs coach and head strength and conditioning coordinator. 
Madison has more than a decade of coaching experience, including stops at Oak Ridge, Clear Brook and Magnolia. Before entering the profession, he was a defensive lineman and tight end for Texas A&M and was a member of the Aggies' Big 12 championship team in 1998. 
A graduate of The Woodlands High School , Madison is married to Leslie Madison , the head volleyball coach and women's athletic coordinator at Magnolia. The couple has three children: Mallory, Morgan and Chase. 
Klein Collins is coming off a season that saw the team advance all the way to the Class 6A Division II state semifinals. The Tigers ultimately lost to eventual state champion DeSoto at NRG Stadium after winning the first regional title in school history. 
Madison's defense was a key part of that success. Klein Collins allowed just 14.1 points per contest and held its opponents to single digits in nine games. The Tigers finished the season with a 13-2 overall record, including a 7-0 mark in District 15-6A play. 
College Park, meanwhile, is coming off a 1-9 season. The Cavs' lone victory came against Conroe in District 12-6A action. Subscribe to HCN
